translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Kaṇikāra Flowers
The Elder Tikaṇikārapupphi’s Birth Story
“The Buddha named Sumedha,
with thirty-two excellent marks,
the Buddha who desired solitude,
went to the Himalayas.
Having entered the Himalayas,
the chief, the compassionate sage,
having sat cross-legged,
sat down, the supreme person.🔽At that time I was a sky-walker,
a master of the three knowledges;
having taken a well-made three-pointed spear,
I was going through the sky then.
Just as a fire on a mountain-top,
or the moon on the full moon day,
the Buddha shines in the forest,
like a blossoming sāla king.
Having come out from the forest,
at the sound of the Buddha’s voice,
with a body the color of a reed,
having seen (him), I was gladdened.
While searching, I saw a flower,
a kaṇikāra, fragrant like the gods;

translated: having taken three flowers,🔽I worshipped the best Buddha.
By the Buddha’s power,
those three flowers of mine then
had their stalks above and their petals below,
making shade for the Teacher.
By that well-performed deed,
by my intention and my vow,
Having given up my human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
There my well-performed deed
is known as the Kaṇikāra (tree);
It is sixty leagues high,
and thirty leagues wide.
With a thousand branches, a hundred shoots,
made of gold, with a net of bells,
with a hundred thousand strings,
my well-performed deed appeared.
Made of gold, made of jewels,
and also made of rubies,
with couches and seats,
whenever and wherever I wish.
And a very valuable bed,
covered with cotton wool,
with a pillow at each end,
and a canopy above.
Having left the dwelling,
walking on the divine walk,
when I wish to go,
with the assembly of gods in front.
I stand below the flower,
my upper covering;
all around a hundred leagues,

translated: Six times I was king of the gods,
Three times I was a universal monarch;
I had a vast kingdom,
incalculable in number.
Wandering in existence,
I obtained great wealth;
I had no lack of wealth,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I wander in two existences,
among the gods and among humans;
I do not know of any other state,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I am born in two families,
among the nobles and among the brahmins;
I am not born in a low family,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
The elephant-vehicle, the horse-vehicle,
the sedan-chair and the palanquin;
I obtain all of these,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
A group of female slaves and a group of male slaves,
Women adorned with ornaments;
I obtain all of these,
This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Silk blankets,
Cotton and linen;
I obtain all of these,
This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
New clothes, new fruits,
New delicious food;
I obtain all of these,
This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Eat this, enjoy this,
Sleep on this bed;
I obtain all of these,
This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Everywhere I am worshipped,
My fame has spread;
I always have a large following,
My retinue is always inseparable;
I am the best of relatives,
This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I do not know cold or heat,
Fever does not exist;
And mental suffering,
Does not exist in my heart.
Having become golden-colored,
I wander through existence and rebirth;
I do not know ugliness,
This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Having fallen from the deva world,
I was accused with a false charge,
I was born in the city of Sāvatthī,
in the great house of the Suadḍhakas.
Abandoning the five sense pleasures,
I went forth into homelessness;
At the age of seven years,
I attained Liberation.
The Buddha, the one with vision,
after knowing my qualities,
Ordained me, the young one who was worthy of worship;
this is the result of worshipping the Buddha.

translated: My divine eye is purified,🔽I am skilled in concentration,

I have reached perfection in the qualities;

For thirty-thousand aeons,

I do not know of a bad destination,

My defilements are burnt up,

I live without pollutants.
How welcome it was for me
to come into the presence of the Buddha;
The three knowledges have been attained,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been accomplished.
The four discriminations,
and the eight liberations,
The six super-knowledges were realized,
and the Buddha’s instruction was fulfilled.”🔽Thus has it been told.
